alert.note: Alert for Callahan; Coleman; Taylor (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS San Angelo (Central Texas San Angelo)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 24 at 5:39AM CDT by NWS San Angelo
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southern Callahan, northern Coleman and central Taylor Counties through 645 AM CDT... At 538 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Coronados Camp, moving southeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Cross Plains, Tuscola, Buffalo Gap, Lawn, Burkett, Dudley, View, Rowden, Coronados Camp, Oplin, Caps, Lake Abilene, Camp Tonkawa, Echo, Lake Coleman, Ovalo, Admiral, Goldsboro and Us- 283 Near The Coleman-Callahan County Line. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
